meanings.definition: A type of fabric made of knotted threads
meanings.sent1: The dress was made of soft netts that flowed gracefully.
meanings.sent2: She bought a scarf made of delicate netts to keep her warm.
meanings.sent3: The netts on the curtains got tangled with the breeze, making them dance.
meanings.sent4: The spider's web glistened in the sunlight, resembling intricate netts.
meanings.sent5: The fisherman repaired his netts before heading out to sea.

meanings.definition: A structure made of ropes or wires used for catching fish or birds
meanings.sent1: The fisherman carefully inspected his netts for any holes.
meanings.sent2: The bird got caught in the netts while trying to escape.
meanings.sent3: The netts swayed gently in the wind, waiting for their next catch.
meanings.sent4: The netts were set up early in the morning to trap the fish.
meanings.sent5: The netts were woven with precision to ensure a successful catch.

meanings.definition: To catch or entangle in a net
meanings.sent1: He tried to netts the butterfly gently without harming its wings.
meanings.sent2: The spider quickly netts its prey in a sticky web.
meanings.sent3: She managed to netts the ball before it rolled away.
meanings.sent4: The detective was determined to netts the criminal and solve the case.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was to netts the audience's attention with his illusions.

meanings.definition: Remaining after all deductions have been made
meanings.sent1: The netts profit from the business was lower than expected.
meanings.sent2: After paying all the bills, she was left with a netts amount of money.
meanings.sent3: The netts balance in the account was enough to cover the expenses.
meanings.sent4: The netts weight of the package was lighter than anticipated.
meanings.sent5: The netts time left before the deadline was running out.
